metadata.title: CVE-2017-5042 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Cast in Google Chrome prior to 57.0.2987.98 for Mac, Windows, and Linux and57.0.2987.108 for Android sent cookies to sites discovered via SSDP, whichallowed an attacker on the local network segment to initiate connections toarbitrary URLs and observe any plaintext cookies sent.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5042` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-browser-l10n - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-chromedriver - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276').
